intro: Antirrhinum albescens, commonly known as the white snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Antirrhinum albescens is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
